Why is apprenticeship a great choice for you?

[ See Step-by-Step Guide](/start-an-apprenticeship)

An apprenticeship is a combination of on-the-job training and classroom learning that leads to a skilled trade credential. It lets you put your brain and body to work, doing something you love. It’s a chance to sharpen your skills, get better at your craft and turn ideas into things you can see, smell, taste and touch. 

Paid training, a satisfying hands-on career, flexibility—these are just a few of the great reasons to consider starting your apprenticeship journey!

![A woman and a man in a workshop looking at each other.](/sites/default/files/2022-12/SKILLED%20TRADES_09132022_108.jpg)

Foundation Programs

Learn the basic knowledge and skills needed for entry into a trade through classroom and shop settings, without a sponsor. 

[ Learn More about Foundation Programs](/foundation-programs)

![](/sites/default/files/2022-12/train%20in%20trades%20program.jpg)

Youth in Trades Programs

Get started in a trade while you’re still in high school, which means learning from experts, gaining hands-on experience and even earning a paycheque—all before you graduate. 

[ Learn More about Youth in Trades Programs](/youth)

![A woman in cooking attire standing in a kitchen. ](/sites/default/files/2022-12/ITA_10122022_039.jpg)

Training Programs for Underrepresented Groups

Explore trades with skills development and employment supports specifically tailored for women, Indigenous peoples and other equity-deserving groups. 

[ Learn More about Training Programs for Underrepresented Groups](/training-programs-underrepresented-groups)

Previous slide __ Next slide __

Financial

Support

If you need financial assistance, there are several options—including grants, loans and tax credits—that you may be eligible for. 

[ Get Support](/financial-support)

![cook](/sites/default/files/2022-12/cook-class-01.jpg)

Advisory

Support

Our Apprenticeship Advisors are available to answer your questions and provide 1-on-1 support. 

[ Get in Touch](/contact-us)

![Two female tradespeople sitting at the back of a truck with supplies.](/sites/default/files/2022-12/ITA_10122022_155.jpg)

Apprenticeship Mobility

If you are registered as an apprentice in another province or territory and relocating, you may be eligible to receive credits towards your apprenticeship in B.C.

[ Learn More](/apprentice-mobility)
